qas.question: How did female Dominican houses differ from male ones?
What did the sisters do instead of apostolic work?
What did the sisters not have?
Who were the nunneries under the jurisdiction of?
What is one role that the friars served as to the nuns?

plausible_answers.text: in a lack of apostolic work

qas.question: How did female house not differ from male Dominican houses?
What did the Benedictine sisters do instead of apostolic work?

plausible_answers.text: general and provincial chapters of the order

qas.question: Whose authority did the sisters not live under?

plausible_answers.text: confessors, priests, teachers and spiritual mentors.

qas.question: What roles did the friars not serve as to the nuns?

context: Female houses differed from male Dominican houses <b5_0>in a <a0_0>lack of apostolic work<b5_0/><a0_0/> for the women. Instead, the sisters <a1_0><b6_0>chanted the Divine Office<b6_0/><a1_0/> and kept all the monastic observances. Their lives were often much more strict than their brothers' lives. The sisters had <b7_0>no <a2_0>government of their own<b7_0/><a2_0/>, but lived under the authority of the <b8_0>general and provincial chapters of the order<b8_0/>. They were compelled to obey all the rules and shared in all the applicable privileges of the order. Like the Priory of Dartford, all Dominican nunneries were under the jurisdiction of <a3_0>friars<a3_0/>. The friars served as their <b9_0>confessors, priests, <a4_0>teachers<a4_0/> and spiritual mentors.
